Detailed Description

Interface class for statements in the ispc language.

This abstract base-class encapsulates methods that AST nodes for statements in the language must implement.

Member Function Documentation

virtual void Stmt::EmitCode ( FunctionEmitContext *  ctx ) const [pure virtual]

Emit LLVM IR for the statement, using the FunctionEmitContext to create the necessary instructions.

Implemented in ExprStmt, DeclStmt, IfStmt, DoStmt, ForStmt, BreakStmt, ContinueStmt, ReturnStmt, StmtList, and PrintStmt.

Referenced by ForStmt::EmitCode(), DoStmt::EmitCode(), lEmitFunctionCode(), and lEmitIfStatements().

virtual Stmt* Stmt::Optimize (  ) [pure virtual]

The Optimize() method should perform any appropriate early-stage optimizations on the node (e.g. constant folding). The caller should use the returned ASTNode * in place of the original node. This method may return NULL if an error is encountered during optimization.

Implements ASTNode.

Implemented in ExprStmt, DeclStmt, IfStmt, DoStmt, ForStmt, BreakStmt, ContinueStmt, ReturnStmt, StmtList, and PrintStmt.

Referenced by Module::AddFunction(), ForStmt::Optimize(), DoStmt::Optimize(), and IfStmt::Optimize().

virtual void Stmt::Print ( int  indent ) const [pure virtual]

Print a representation of the statement (and any children AST nodes) to standard output. This method is used for debuggins.

Implemented in ExprStmt, DeclStmt, IfStmt, DoStmt, ForStmt, BreakStmt, ContinueStmt, ReturnStmt, StmtList, and PrintStmt.

Referenced by Module::AddFunction(), ForStmt::Print(), DoStmt::Print(), and IfStmt::Print().

virtual Stmt* Stmt::TypeCheck (  ) [pure virtual]

Type checking should be performed by the node when this method is called. In the event of an error, a NULL value may be returned. As with ASTNode::Optimize(), the caller should store the returned pointer in place of the original ASTNode *.

Implements ASTNode.

Implemented in ExprStmt, DeclStmt, IfStmt, DoStmt, ForStmt, BreakStmt, ContinueStmt, ReturnStmt, StmtList, and PrintStmt.

Referenced by Module::AddFunction(), ForStmt::TypeCheck(), DoStmt::TypeCheck(), and IfStmt::TypeCheck().
